node.title: Oral Health and Overall Health
node.label: 19. May 2020
node.introduction: How much do you know? Maybe you haven't given it much thought, after all who thinks that joint pain, confusion or heart health is related to their mouth. Surprisingly it is!

node.title: Dogs and Gut Health
node.label: 15. May 2020
node.introduction: If you have a dog, ask yourself this question. Why did you make the decision to get him or her?

node.alt: Photo of a puppy.  We all love a puppy.

node.title: Coconut, Cacao Chia Pots
node.introduction: These creamy pots of yumminess are packed full of fibre and heart health omega 3 fats. They also happen to be vegan, gluten and dairy free! Enjoy at breakfast or anytime of the day!

node.title: Tahini, Date & Cacao Cookies
node.introduction: Nothing beats a cuppa and a bit of homemaking! These cookies are super delicious and a good source of protein, fibre and energy giving B vitamins.

node.text:
So I made this quick, easy & delicious 3 ingredient ice-cream üçå üç´ ü•ú #thepowerofthree

It's ready in around 1 minute!!! Yes 1 minute as long as you have frozen bananas. If you don't it's worth keeping a few in the freezer for when ice-cream fever strikes! 

Ingredients:
2 frozen ripe bananas.
2 tbsp peanut butter (I used crunchy)
1 tbsp raw cacao powder or cocoa powder

Method: 
Stick in a blender and whizz until it forms an ice-cream consistency. Serve in a bowl or your favourite type of cone. 

Thank you @tamarawalpolenutrition for the inspo and recipe. 

#homemadetreats #sugarglutendairyfree #dairyfreeicecreamrecipe #fridayicecream #3ingredients #eathomecooked #rebalancingyou #flamingopower #loveflamingos #myfavouritethings #veganin3 #plantbaseddesserts

One Pot Perri Perri Chicken (well kinda)
I love one pot dishes mainly because it's less washing up but how come my kitchen still looks a mess? ü§î

Ingredients:
‚ñ™Ô∏è600g skinless/boneless chicken thighs 
‚ñ™Ô∏è1 red pepper
‚ñ™Ô∏è1 yellow pepper
‚ñ™Ô∏è1 red onion
‚ñ™Ô∏è2 fat cloves of garlic
‚ñ™Ô∏èA small bunch of basil + a few leaves to garnish
‚ñ™Ô∏è1 teaspoon chilli paste or a whole red chilli
‚ñ™Ô∏è4 sun dried tomatoes from a jar
‚ñ™Ô∏è2 large roasted peppers from a jar
‚ñ™Ô∏èA good splash of apple cider vinegar or white wine vinegar
‚ñ™Ô∏èThe juice of half a lemon
‚ñ™Ô∏èOlive oil
‚ñ™Ô∏èSalt & pepper

Method: 
‚úÖ Cut the peppers into 6 pieces each and remove the seeds set a side.
‚úÖ Cut the thighs into 2 or three pieces, season with a little salt and pepper. 
‚úÖ Add some oil to an oven proof pan/casserole dish over a high heat when the oil is smoking add the peppers and the chicken and cook for a few minutes until they are browned and beginning to crisp at the edges.
‚úÖ Add all the remaining ingredients with a little seasoning to a blender, blitz it up to get a thick sauce. If its too thick add a splash of water or olive oil. 
‚úÖ Pour it over the peppers and chicken making sure it is evenly distributed. Cook in a pre-heated oven at 200 for 25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. 
‚úÖ Scatter with the reserved basil and serve with greens and baby roasted potatoes or a mixed salad and crusty bread. 
#onepotwonders #perriperrichicken #flexitarian #eatyourgreens #blitzupasauce #rebalancingyou #healthysuppers #glutenfreeguthealth #sugarglutendairyfree #guthealthmatters #glutenfreegutfoods #eattherainbow #mixitup #eatmeatsometimes

These are some of the things in season in JULY why not try to incorporate them into your diet? Here's 5 reasons why.....

PACKED WITH FLAVOUR ‚Äì Fruit & veg that is picked when it‚Äôs ready and ripe tastes amazing. If it is coming from another country,  it's often picked before it‚Äôs ripe and sprayed with chemicals to prevent it ripening too much before it gets to you. 

BETTER NUTRITION ‚Äì Picking fruit & veg before it‚Äôs ripe, means the nutrients aren't fully developed. The sun helps plants to grow, picking them before they are ready reduces this valuable growing and nutrient development time. If you eat seasonally, you are more likely to eat a variety of different fruit & veg, which helps you to eat a balanced diet.

SAVES YOU MONEY‚Äì Fruit & veg in season is more abundant, so it costs less in the shops. Buying out of season, means that it has to travel, which takes time and costs money. Sellers pass these costs onto you which means you are paying more. 

IT'S GOOD FOR THE ENVIRONMENT‚Äì Food that travels impacts our carbon footprint. Fruit & veg closer to home means less travel which means less petrol and less carbon emissions.

COMMUNITY BENEFITS‚Äì Buying local from independents like local farms and greengrocers means supporting smaller businesses and helps to build your community. It also helps us feel more connected to where our food is coming from and who is growing it. 
#eatmoreveg #eatyourgreens #shoplocal #eattheseasons #seasonalbenefits #feedyourmicrobiome #plantbased #eattherainbow #sweetseasonalfood #rebalancingyou

metadata.siteDescription: ENERGISE, RESTORE, NOURISH. I'm studying with the renowned Institute for Optimum Nutrition and will qualify next year. Until then, this is a place to inspire and share healthful information, tips, tricks and recipes. I hope to energise, restore and nourish your body mind and soul!
